sentences.en: Below you, though still 50 miles off, is the most treeless stretch of land imaginable.
sentences.cn: 就在你下方，不过是在50英里开外的，是一片你能想象到的最荒凉的不毛之地。

sentences.en: He could not disguise that he had had the worst imaginable day for any minister.
sentences.cn: 他刚刚经历了对于任何部长而言都是最糟糕的一天，这对他来说无法掩饰。

sentences.en: Here the broad waters were crowded with every imaginable craft.
sentences.cn: 这儿宽阔的水面上挤满了船只,凡想象得到的船舶应有尽有.

sentences.en: His manner as he said this was the most quiet imaginable.
sentences.cn: 他这么说的时候,神态说不出有多宁静.

sentences.en: It is imaginable that breaking the engagement will damage his image.
sentences.cn: 可以想象,违反婚约将损害他的形象.

sentences.en: It will be the greatest imaginable privation for her to have to leave london.
sentences.cn: 对她来说,不得不离开伦敦大概是能想像到的最大的损失.

sentences.en: Its 22 courses will cover every style imaginable anddecidedly non - traditional designs.
sentences.cn: 它的22块球场将涵盖能够想到的所有风格 —— 从草地到沙地,再到奥古斯塔(Augusta)似的完美——还包括一些完全反传统的设计.

sentences.en: Modern communication technologies certainly offer the most versatile classrooms imaginable.
sentences.cn: 现代通讯技术当然能提供无所不包的理想课堂.

sentences.en: The house has the most spectacular views imaginable.
sentences.cn: 从这所房子可以看到所能想象的最壮丽的景色。

sentences.en: The travel brochure is full of the most wonderful resorts imaginable.
sentences.cn: 这本旅游小册子里全是人们梦寐以求的最好的旅游胜地。

sentences.en: The youths were initiated into manhood by the most frightful ordeals imaginable.
sentences.cn: 青年人要经受难以想像的严峻考验才能被承认进入成年期.

sentences.en: They glow ecstatically, ablaze with the brightest love, happiness and joy imaginable.
sentences.cn: 他们心醉神迷地发着光,与所能想象的最明亮的爱 、 乐、喜悦一起闪烁.

sentences.en: This is the only solution imaginable.
sentences.cn: 这是唯一想得出的解决办法.

sentences.en: We had the greatest difficulty imaginable getting here in time.
sentences.cn: 我们为了及时赶到此地,经历了可能想见的最大的困难.

sentences.en: We had the greatest difficulty imaginable.
sentences.cn: 我们遇到了可以想象到的最大困难.

sentences.en: We have been inundated with every bit of information imaginable.
sentences.cn: 凡是想得到的各种各样的信息潮水般地向我们涌来.

words.tran_cn: 虚构的，假想的；想像的；虚数的
虚构的；富于想像的；有创造力的
[心理] 想象力；空想；幻想物

trans.tran_en: used to emphasize that something is the best, worst etc that can be imagined
